) is the capital of Mon State in

value: Overnight bus Shwe Mandalar (15,000 kyat), leaves from the Highway Bus Station. Quite luxurious (Swedish) bus, includes a towel, pillow, blanket toothbrushes and water. Starts at 18:00, arrives in Mawlamyine at 05:00, with at least two stops on the way.
Don't pay more than 500 kyat for transport from the bus station to the city centre (motorbike/trishaw)
Many motorbike-taxis, trishaws, pick-ups available at the central market
Motorbike-taxi / shared trishaw should cost no more than 250 kyat in town

content=Pagoda which contains a century-old replica of the Buddha in Mahamuni Paya in Mandalay. Here you can get a nicer view of the Buddha, woman are allowed to get closer and way less tourists compared to Mandalay. However the gold cover of the Buddha is not nearly as thick as in Mandalay.
content=The main attraction of this pagoda is a golden rock formation, similar to

, but on a smaller scale. However, due its shape and balance (3 stones on top of each other) this golden rock looks more impressive. To go there you can get pick-ups from the roundabout in front of the bridge (the location in Lonely Planet is wrong, the buses start about 500 m further west). They charge you 1,000 kyat, maybe cheaper if you haggle. Trishaw-taxis offer you the same trip for 8,000 kyat return, but you can get them down to 5,000 kyat (which is worth it as return pick-ups are rare). From the base of the mountain you can either hike up (at least 2 hr each way. Bring enough water and good shoes as the heat and humidity are killers) or you can try to get a work truck (2,000 kyat per person return). If you go in low season and on a work day, there is a fair chance that you will be the only person there. Thus, the work truck can be more expensive, if they even run! Going back, you can wait for a passing pick-up or trishaw. Organised shared pick-ups are rare, especially in the late afternoon. Important: take sun block with you!
directions=14 km south of town. Take the local pick-up south
content=Enormous, tranquil meditation centre with friendly people. Arrive by 10:00 to walk to the eating hall for an 11:00 meal with hundreds of monks (and a few foreigners studying meditation).
price=1,000 kyat (vegetarian), 2,000 kyat (meat), 2,500 kyat (seafood), 1,500 kyat for a bottle of Myanmar beer
content=Chinese restaurant with extensive menu in English. Actually more an amusement arcade/gambling hall than restaurant.
directions=Along Strand Rd, south of Breeze Guesthouse
price=2,000+ kyat for food, 500 kyat for cakes, 1,200 kyat coffee shakes, 1,700 kyat cocktails
content=Western cuisine, nice decor, air-con, and popular with local couples. Try the mojitos!
directions=Along Strand Rd, next to Breeze Guesthouse

content=New building, big English sign, notably more expensive than in its former incarnation as a budget eatery! Nonetheless a popular spot for locals, standard food but decent portions and it is claimed that the profits help the elderly in Mawlamyine.
content=Chinese restaurant with menu in English.
content=Well-known guesthouse with friendly staff. Mr. Anthony is an old man and full of stories including useful advice.
content=New hotel, fully tiled and clean, incredibly friendly staff, price includes breakfast and TV in room.
Bus for 1,000 kyat, takes around 2 hr but is extremely old and has no air-con.
Overnight bus Shwe Mandalar (15,000 kyat), leaves from the bus station. Quite luxurious (Swedish) bus, includes a towel, pillow, blanket, toothbrushes, and water.
